title: Fix armor formula to include monster level
description: Current armor formula uses armor / (armor + 100) which ignores monster level. GDD specifies: Damage Reduction % = Armor / (Armor + K) where K = 100 + (10 * Monster Level). This makes armor less effective against higher-level monsters, adding a meaningful scaling pressure.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: Clear task spec with exact line numbers and formula made implementation straightforward
- What was unclear: Whether enemy projectiles should carry level info from their source enemy; defaulted to level 1 for now since projectile entities don't have a level property
close_reason: Armor formula now scales with monster level per GDD: armor / (armor + 100 + 10 * monsterLevel)

title: Brainstorm: 15-20 new enemy types with shapes, behaviors, and attack patterns
description: Design new enemy types beyond the current 7 (Rusher, Swarm, Tank, Sniper, Flanker, Splitter, Shielder). Each needs: name, geometric shape, color, movement AI, attack pattern, status effects applied, HP/damage tier, and what makes them interesting to fight. Think about positioning puzzles — enemies that force the player to move in specific ways. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/enemies.ts.
close_reason: Designed 18 new enemy types in designs/enemies.ts with full TypeScript interfaces. Each enemy has shape, color, movement AI, attack pattern, status effects, stat tiers, detailed AI behavior descriptions, tactical roles, and synergy notes. Also included 10 named enemy combo formations for wave design. All shapes and colors are distinct from existing 7 enemies and from each other for colorblind accessibility.

title: Brainstorm: 10-12 zone themes with hazards, palettes, and enemy compositions
description: Design zone themes beyond the current 8. Each needs: name, background/grid/wall/accent colors, environmental hazards (burning ground, slow zones, darkness, etc.), which enemy types spawn and at what ratios, ambient particle effects, and a visual gimmick that makes the zone feel distinct. Also redesign/expand existing zones with more depth. Think about how the zone theme changes gameplay — not just cosmetic. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/zones.ts.
close_reason: Designed 12 zone themes in designs/zones.ts with full TypeScript interfaces and structured definitions. Each zone includes: color palette (bg/grid/wall/accent), environmental hazards with detailed mechanics, enemy spawn weight distributions, ambient particle descriptions, visual gimmicks, gameplay impact analysis, and tier-scaled map size hints. Zones progress from tutorial (The Grid) through mid-game (Reactor Core, Frozen Array, Overgrowth, Storm Network) to endgame (The Abyss, Chromatic Rift, Null Sector), with each designed to change combat dynamics not just cosmetics.

title: Wire map tier bonus into monster scaling
description: Map tier bonus (mapTierBonus) is always 0 in MonsterScaling.ts. The MapItem's tier value needs to be passed through to the scaling config so higher-tier maps actually produce tougher monsters. Per GDD formula: Monster Level = max(Map Base Level, Player Level - 2) + Map Tier Bonus.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: Clear task description with exact file paths and line numbers made this straightforward to implement.
- What was unclear: Nothing -- the implementation steps were well-defined.
close_reason: Map tier bonus now wired into monster scaling. MapDevice tracks activeTierBonus from mapItem.tier, WaveSystem and EnemySpawner use getActiveTierBonus() instead of DEFAULT_SCALING_CONFIG.

title: Brainstorm: 8-10 map layout variants with room shapes and environmental features
description: Design map layout variants beyond basic BSP rooms+corridors. Ideas: arena rooms (large open spaces for boss fights), trap corridors (narrow with hazards), treasure vaults (small rooms with guaranteed loot), branching paths with dead ends, circular rooms with pillars, bridge rooms over void, maze sections. Each needs: name, room shape/dimensions, environmental features (pillars, pits, destructibles), how it affects combat flow. Consider how the rot-js Digger can be extended or post-processed. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/maps.ts.
close_reason: Designed 10 map layout variants in designs/maps.ts with full TypeScript interfaces. Each variant includes room patterns, environmental features (pillars, pits, bridges, destructibles, slow ground), class-specific combat flow notes, post-processing rules for rot-js Digger output, special rooms, and tier scaling notes.

title: Add gem removal crafting recipe
description: GDD states gems can be removed and reused for a gold cost. Currently gems are permanent once socketed. Add a gem removal recipe to CraftingPanel/CraftingSystem that costs gold, returns the gem to the player's backpack, and clears the item's socket.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: Clear task spec with exact file locations and line numbers made implementation straightforward. Existing recipe pattern was easy to follow.
- What was unclear: Nothing significant -- the task was well-scoped.
close_reason: Added Remove Gem crafting recipe (1 Essence cost) that extracts a socketed gem back to the player's gem inventory while preserving the empty socket on the item. Stats recalc triggered on use.

description: Design new wave formations and encounter patterns beyond the current 5 (column, pincer, surround, shieldWall, chaoticSwarm). Think about puzzle-like encounters that reward specific positioning or skill usage. Ideas: escort waves, timed survival arenas, enemy combos that synergize (healers + tanks, teleporters + snipers), boss rush mini-waves, progressive difficulty ramps within a single wave. Each needs: name, enemy composition, spawn positions/timings, what makes it tactically interesting. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/waves.ts.

title: Content brainstorm blitz: enemies, bosses, zones, uniques, waves, maps, affixes, music
description: Use parallel opus agents to generate large volumes of game content designs across 8 categories. Output structured TypeScript-ready files in designs/ directory for review and cherry-picking. Phase 1 is brainstorm only — no code integration yet.
close_reason: All 8 brainstorm tasks completed in parallel: enemies (18), bosses (10), zones (12), uniques (24), waves (15), maps (10), affixes (18), music (10). Output in designs/ directory.

title: Brainstorm: 8-10 ChipPlayer music tracks for zones, bosses, and events
description: Design chiptune music tracks as ChipPlayer JSON patterns. Current tracks: menu, town, combat, boss, victory. Need zone-specific tracks and event music. Each needs: name, context (which zone/event), mood/tempo description, instrument choices (square, triangle, sawtooth, sine, pulse, noise, pluck, FM), key/scale, BPM, and ideally a rough melody outline or chord progression. Consider dynamic elements (tempo shifts for boss enrage, minor key for low HP). Reference the ChipPlayer engine capabilities: 4-channel, ADSR, biquad filters, Karplus-Strong. Output as structured definitions in designs/music.ts.
close_reason: Designed 10 music tracks in designs/music.ts with full compositional blueprints: 6 zone tracks (The Grid, Neon Wastes, Reactor Core, Frozen Array, Overgrowth, Storm Network, The Abyss, Chromatic Rift), 1 boss enrage track, and 1 death stinger. Each includes BPM, key/scale, 4-channel instrument definitions with wave/ADSR/filter specs, chord progressions, melody outlines, bass/percussion patterns, dynamic elements, and composition notes. All designs reference ChipPlayer engine capabilities and complement the 5 existing tracks.

title: Add stat respec for gold
description: Currently there is no way to undo stat point allocation. GDD says respec should be available at a gold cost. Options: add a Respec button to the stat panel (Tab), or add it as an NPC interaction in town. Should reset all stat points and refund them for re-spending. Gold cost could scale with level.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: Clean integration into existing StatPanel pattern -- reused applyStatEffects, same button styling conventions, and the existing ECS query pattern extended with 'gold'.
- What was unclear: Whether floating text should appear in world space or panel space -- chose panel-local feedback text since the player is interacting with UI, not the game world.
close_reason: Stat respec available in stat panel for gold. Respec button added below computed stats, costs level*50 gold, refunds all allocated points, grayed out when no stats allocated or insufficient gold, with feedback text.

title: Brainstorm: 8-10 unique boss encounters with multi-phase mechanics
description: Design zone-specific bosses with distinct multi-phase mechanics. Each needs: name, zone theme, geometric shape/visual, 3-5 phase transitions with escalating abilities, telegraphed attacks, add wave patterns, and a signature mechanic that makes each fight memorable. Current boss is a generic white hexagon — these should feel like unique encounters. Consider mechanics like arena hazards, invulnerability windows, positioning tests. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/bosses.ts.
close_reason: Designed 10 unique boss encounters across all 8 zone themes in designs/bosses.ts. Each boss has 3-5 phases with HP thresholds, escalating abilities, telegraphed attacks, add waves, a signature mechanic, enrage timer, and Ranger/Mage strategy notes. Bosses cover mechanical variety: tutorial (Sentinel Prime), positioning puzzle (Void Weaver), DPS race (Meltdown), control/debuff (Cryo Matrix), add management (Overmind), spatial awareness (Arc Tyrant), atmosphere/resource (Dread Hollow), adaptation (Prism Lord), multitasking (Recursion), and endurance (Nullpoint).

title: Implement remaining map modifiers (Fire Enchanted, Volatile, Iron Skin, Empowered Boss)
description: 4 of 7 map modifiers are defined in the pool and displayed in the UI but have no gameplay effect. Need to implement: (1) Fire Enchanted - enemies apply Burn status on hit, (2) Volatile - enemies explode on death dealing AoE damage, (3) Iron Skin - enemies resist first hit (shield/absorb), (4) Empowered Boss - boss gets +2 extra phases. Only hp_boost, speed_boost, and extra_swarm currently work.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: The codebase already had partial scaffolding for 3 of 4 modifiers (iron skin check in CollisionSystem, fire enchanted on contact, volatile with damage). This made it straightforward to fill in the gaps.
- What was unclear: The volatile modifier's original implementation used enemy.damage * 0.5 which could be 0 for snipers; switching to 15% max HP is more consistent. The empowered boss phase scaling needed careful interpolation to feel smooth across 5 phases instead of just 3.
close_reason: All 7 map modifiers now have runtime effects. Implemented: (1) Fire Enchanted - enemies apply Burn on contact AND projectile hits, (2) Volatile - 15% max HP AoE explosion on death with orange particle burst, (3) Iron Skin - first hit absorbed (0 damage) with grey number, (4) Empowered Boss - 5 phases (0.8/0.6/0.4/0.2 thresholds) with escalating attack speed and burst count.

title: Audit and implement unique item runtime effects
description: 12 unique items are defined in UniqueItems.ts with effectIds, but it's unclear how many actually trigger runtime behavior. Need to: (1) audit which effectIds are handled in WeaponBehaviors.ts and StatEffects.ts, (2) identify which are missing runtime implementations, (3) implement the missing ones. Effects include: splinterbow_spread, inferno_burning_ground, voidcaster_frost_nova, phasewalker_trap, echoes_cooldown_reset, vampiric_leech, prism_status_amplify, grid_extra_projectile, chrono_cheat_death, essence_kill_frenzy.
notes:
## Retro
- What worked: Reading all files first to understand the full architecture before making changes. The hasEffect() helper pattern kept changes simple and localized. Building after all changes confirmed zero type errors.
- What was unclear: Whether grid_extra_projectile should apply to AoE skills (Rain of Arrows, Meteor) or just projectile skills. Chose projectile-only since +1 projectile for AoE doesn't make conceptual sense.
close_reason: All 12 unique item effects implemented at runtime. Created UniqueEffects.ts helper and hooked into CollisionSystem, HealthSystem, SkillSystem, StatusEffectSystem, Projectile.ts, Ranger.ts, and Mage.ts. Build passes clean.

title: Brainstorm: 20-25 unique items with build-defining effects
description: Design unique items beyond the current 12. Cover all slots (weapons, armor, rings, amulets, offhands) for both Ranger and Mage. Each needs: name, slot, base stats, a signature effect that changes HOW you play (not just bigger numbers), and ideally synergy with specific skills or playstyles. Think about effects like: converting damage types, changing skill behavior, creating new mechanics (summons, auras, on-dodge effects). Reference GDD design pillar: mechanical depth over number inflation. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/uniques.ts.
close_reason: Designed 24 new unique items in designs/uniques.ts. Coverage: 3 Ranger weapons, 3 Mage weapons, 4 helmets, 2 chests, 3 boots, 3 rings, 4 amulets, 3 offhands. Each has build-defining effects (element conversion, skill behavior changes, conditional mechanics, positional rewards), synergy notes, and implementation guidance. Respects GDD constraints: no crit, no leech, tight scaling.

title: Brainstorm: 15-20 new conditional affixes that change playstyle
description: Design new conditional/chase affixes beyond the current 4 (condMovingDamage, condOnKillHeal, condLowHPDamage, condPostSkillAtkSpd). These are the loot excitement layer — rare affixes on Rare+ items that change behavior, not just numbers. Ideas: distance-based bonuses, combo chains, elemental conversions, stat breakpoint unlocks, skill enhancements, on-dodge effects, full-health bonuses, multi-kill streaks. Must not break the math (no multiplicative scaling). Reference GDD affix design. Output as structured TypeScript definitions in designs/affixes.ts.
close_reason: Designed 18 chase affixes in designs/affixes.ts covering 6 categories: positioning rewards (3), kill chain/momentum (3), health threshold risk/reward (3), skill interaction/combo (3), status effect interactions (3), stat breakpoints (3), and defensive/survival (3 -- one was already part of existing conditionals, replaced with 2 new ones plus the no-damage-taken affix). All additive, no multiplicative scaling, no crit/leech. Exported as AFFIX_DESIGNS array with full TypeScript interface.
